This Expert Witness Report by Danny Farnham is based on firsthand, on-site observation

[Gulfstream - Prehearing Brief .pdf, p.53]
IN WITNESS WHEREOF. the parties have caused this Proposal to be executed by their duly authorized representatives. Copies of a

[Leonard Beauchemin Outline #1.docx, p.1]
Witness Role: Rebuttal expert for Gulfstream regarding 192-month inspection standards and industry practices.

[In re CITCOM v Gulfstream - Analysis of Claims and Defenses Related to Repairs on GS550-5174(80915932.pdf, p.10]
5. Using an expert witness to opine on industry standards for repair times and the reasonableness of

[CITIOM v. GAC - Confidentiality Agreement and Proposed Protective Order.pdf, p.4]
to any party or witness.

[(v3) 5. Joe Schuster - Cross Exam & Impeachment.docx, p.1]
Scope: Primary on-the-ground project lead for CITIOM’s 192-month inspection. Testimony critical to establishing Gulfstream’s contemporaneous knowledge of scope growth, internal misrepresentations, staffing failures, and misleading RTS forecasts.

[1. Bassim Haider Direct Outline with Redirect & Rehab.docx, p.1]
Scope: Mr. Haidar will testify to CITIOM’s ownership and use of the Aircraft, its business reliance on Gulfstream, and the financial and operational impact of Gulfstream’s delays and misrepresentations during the 192-month inspection. His testimony reinforces CITIOM’s reliance, foreseeability, and damages narrative.

[2. Craig Kleebe - Cross Exam & Impeachment.docx, p.1]
Scope: Klebe oversaw proposal quoting processes, including the cost and downtime estimates provided to CITIOM for the 192-month inspection. His internal communications reveal knowledge of systemic underestimation and failure to apply updated forecasting tools. His testimony is central to CITIOM’s misrepresentation claims and spoliation arguments.

[3. Murtaza Hassan - Cross Exam & Impeachment.docx, p.1]
Scope: Oversight of S/N 5174’s 192-month inspection at the St. Louis facility. Hassan was the primary Gulfstream point of contact for CITIOM and authored key project communications. His testimony is critical to exposing project mismanagement, staffing failures, and misleading client updates.

[CITIOM v. Gulfstream-FAZ Report.pdf, p.3]
provided testimony. The CV further details my expertise and experience relevant
